heading: Atmospheric river to wallop Pacific Northwest
description: Another round of heavy potentially flooding rain is forecast across portions of the Pacific Northwest on Thursday and into Friday thanks to an atmospheric river that's forecast to hit the region. The heavy rain will create areas of flash flooding, and urban areas, roads and small streams will be the most vulnerable, primarily in Washington an Oregon, the National Weather Service said The storm could drop nearly a monthâ€™s worth of rain in some areas.
